dct_description_sm: GADM is a spatial database of the location of the world's administrative areas (or adminstrative boundaries) for use in GIS and similar software. Administrative areas in this database are countries and lower level subdivisions such as provinces, departments, bibhag, bundeslander, daerah istimewa, fivondronana, krong, landsvæðun, opština, sous-préfectures, counties, and thana. GADM describes where these administrative areas are (the "spatial features"), and for each area it provides some attributes, such as the name and variant names.
Data downloaded from Global Administrative Areas (http://gadm.org/) on December 2, 2017.
dct_creator_sm: University of California, Berkeley, Museum of Vertebrate Zoology
dct_publisher_sm: University of California, Berkeley. Museum of Vertebrate Zoology
dct_rights_sm: This dataset is freely available for academic use and other non-commercial use. Redistribution, or commercial use is not allowed without prior permission. You are free to create maps and use the data in other ways for publication in academic journals, books, reports, etc.
